page.title: 17River Avon
page.content:
River Avon
The River Avon runs through part of our survey area.The river is very pretty here,with fields on either side.Many pleasure boats use the river _ particulaly narrow boats _ and many people moor by King George's Field next to the market.Sailing boats and canoes also use the river.Wyre Lock is on our stretch of the river and next to that is Wyre Mill Club which was an old grist mill that has been converted.The River often floods into the surrounding fields, and in winter it sometimes freezes.One year it froze so hard that a Land Rover drove along it. Many people fish in the river.It provides coarse fishing for bream, roads,perch and eels.
